file_content.text: Hey. Personal space.
You draw attention to us, it's your problem.
Got a good operation here, Jedi.
But, too many people. Inefficient. Can't watch them all.
Everyone aboard has proved their loyalty and devotion.
They're all trustworthy.
They've proved it to you. Not to me.
Not everyone is out to get you, Zenith.
You don't need to be paranoid.
Last few years taught me otherwise.
Now I have you to be vigilant for me.
You could watch my back.
Consider it done.
Be tough to adjust. Strange to be off Balmorra, with political power.
Peace will be even stranger.
Want to let you know. Kind of enjoyed working with you.
Not often my comrades survive this long.
I'm glad to be the exception to that particular rule.
I'm happy to surprise you.
Yeah. Me too.
Is there a compliment hidden in there somewhere?
Er, thank you?
Just a fact. Not good or bad.
My training makes me rather difficult to kill.
Jedi are tough.
So I noticed.
Anyway. Just wanted to say. I... trust you.
So I'd better stick around. Keep you alive. Trustworthy people are hard to come by.
Refugees are back on Balmorra. Arrived just before polling started for opposition leader's post.
Balmorran public got to see collaborators in chains. Got plenty of positive messages during the polls.
Those refugees still deserve a chance to prove their innocence.
So you arrested them.
Not my problem. Got my future to think of.
Do you know the results yet?
Did you win the vote?
The Balmorran people get justice, you get publicity and more voters. Everyone wins.
Then everyone's happy.
Very, very true.
Votes are in. I won, Nalan Fiskin lost. I'm opposition leader. Seat in government, everything. Feels... good.
If you're opposition leader, won't you be returning to Balmorra?
Does that mean you're leaving?
No. Can work in absentia, until you're done gallivanting around.
I imagine Nalan Fiskin isn't too pleased?
How's your rival taking it?
He's not happy. Which makes me happy. Balances out.
Perhaps some day the presidency will be in your reach.
The sky's the limit now.
Tai Cordan can stay president. For now.
Wanted... to thank you. For your help. Couldn't have got that edge without you.
Oh, and--Gray Star's journals. Put two blaster shots through the datapad. Destroyed, like Gray Star wanted.
I'm glad you chose to honor his wishes. Eventually.
Good, you kept your word.
Simply erasing the datapad would have done the job, you know.
Was shooting it necessary?
Never occurred to me.
Those journals could have been useful in the future.
What a waste.
Got what I needed from them. Plus, perspective.
All done living in the past. Future is what matters--Balmorra's, and mine.
My own people. Can't even trust my own people.
Take a deep breath and explain what's going on.
Settle down.
Did something happen with your political supporters?
You mean your voters?
People let you down. I thought you knew that by now.
You shouldn't trust anyone.
Those Balmorran refugees. I wanted to bring them home. Already arranged to meet them on Alderaan.
Then I decipher more of Gray Star's journals. Found out why he didn't want me reading them.
Journals report these refugees were in contact with local Imperial officials. Negotiating for food. Medicine. Protection.
The refugees were alone and defenseless; they likely had no choice.
They were trying to survive.
Not good enough!
Gray Star was aware the refugees were trading with Imperials?
And Gray Star knew about this?
Yes! Wrote it down, never lifted a finger!
These refugees could still be in contact with the Empire.
They are traitors, then.
Imperials would have offered anything for intelligence about Balmorra. How many refugees gave in? Gave information and got my people killed?
Gray Star... let it happen. But he knew I'd retaliate. So he kept this from me.
Gray Star clearly didn't want these people punished for what they did.
Yes, to protect the refugees.
He was too trusting.
So what happens now you know the truth?
What are you going to do?
If the refugees did trade information, that could have contributed to Gray Star's downfall.
That was Gray Star's undoing.
They're collaborators. Collaborators die, or live in a cell.
Already arranged to meet the refugee leaders. To help them home. But now, they'll be going in chains. For conspiring with the enemy.
I arrest the guilty, I prove my devotion to Balmorra.
You can't do this. Those refugees are coming to the meeting in good faith.
No. Arresting them is wrong.
They sold us out. They get the mercy the Imperials showed us.
You must pardon these people for their mistakes. Or the Imperial occupation will never truly end.
Forgive them. For Balmorra.
Always, Jedi words.
There's no proof they sold anyone out. If you arrest them on a hunch, you're no better than the Empire.
You don't know they're guilty.
They're guilty. I'm... positive.
Are you doing this because it's right, or because it will further your political career?
Is this justice, or ambition?
Can't be both?
Have to think this over myself. Decide what needs to be done.
You're Balmorran, just as they are. You must serve your people as you see fit.
If you think this is best.
If those refugees walked free, it would cheapen the sacrifices of everyone who stood up to the Empire.
They must be punished.
All settled, then.
Need to get things organized for their arrest. Make sure soldiers are waiting for them. Excuse me.
Polling for opposition leader begins soon. Me against Fiskin. Need one last push.
Remember Gray Star's journals? Managed to decipher more entries from the shorthand. Gave me an idea.
Journals say Gray Star smuggled out Balmorran refugees, to camps off-world. Hundreds, in secret. They won't know Balmorra's liberated.
Do the journals say where they were smuggled to?
Can you find them?
I've got contact details.
It's time they heard the good news, and came home.
Then someone should tell them.
My thinking too.
Perhaps these people could be persuaded to support you.
More potential voters.
I want to bring them home.
Helping these people is a duty. And good publicity. Should sway any undecided voters.
I'll contact the refugees' leaders. But... need somewhere safe to meet.
I once attended a diplomatic summit in a cavern on Alderaan. It's quiet, and secure.
Sounds perfect. I'll set it up.
Political campaigning's heating up back home. Nalan Fiskin was rivaling me in the polls.
But, decided what to do. About that evidence Fiskin took an Imperial bribe.
Leaked it through the HoloNet. Hundreds of Fiskin's supporters switched to me.
Their votes should put you ahead, correct?
So you're winning.
Can't celebrate yet.
No doubt they see Fiskin as a traitor.
They must be furious.
You've publicly humiliated him. Be prepared for some backlash.
Fiskin will be more dangerous.
Already happened.
Fiskin's preparing a speech, to regain lost ground. Got a very talented speechwriter. He could still turn this around.
I could ensure Fiskin's speechwriter has an accident. Non-fatal accident.
No "accidents". You could address the Balmorran people first, and steal Fiskin's momentum.
Or, you give a speech instead.
Public speaking's not my forte.
It's easy. Relax, be honest. Let them get to know you.
Simply be yourself.
This is me.
Fighting Imperials didn't leave much time to hone your rhetoric, did it?
That doesn't surprise me.
"Please vote for me." That'll do.
I'll let you know how it goes.
Just tell them you love Balmorra, you'll keep her strong against the Empire, et cetera.
Say what they want to hear.
Whatever gets them voting.
Thanks for the advice.
If you must do this, be sure the speechwriter isn't hurt.
Fine. Make it painless.
Painless, but debilitating. Huh, chance to be creative.
An accident's too obvious. But if the speechwriter got sick, no one would suspect you.
An illness would work better.
Hmm. Got biowarfare experience... Dose of Balmorran flu would work.
Good suggestion. Wish we'd had you in the war.
Been working on my combat technique.
Noticed some flaws, after fighting alongside you. All corrected now.
Everything looked fine to me.
I didn't see any flaws...
Don't. Please. Problems were obvious.
I suppose it never hurts to be meticulous.
Er, well done.
I'm no use dead.
We never know when an attack might come; sloppy combat technique wouldn't serve us well.
Good, I need you at your best.
Not an issue, now.
Jedi. You're alright.
Back. Met Kaylan Jase. Journals are safe.
It must have been good to see your friend again.
How is Jase doing?
Not so good.
Have you had a chance to study them?
Let's hope they're useful.
Started. But had thinking to do.
Then we should move on.
Something you should know first.
Jase didn't want to give me the journals. Said Gray Star left standing orders. If he was killed or captured, the journals should be destroyed.
And Gray Star told Jase not to give the journals to me. Ever. For any reason.
I hope Jase had an explanation for these orders.
Why not?
No. Says he didn't ask.
How did you convince Jase to give you them to you?
Yet you got the journals.
Shot him in the foot.
That might have been a ruse to keep the journals for himself.
Jase could have been lying.
Didn't work. Shot him in the foot, got the journals anyway.
Started reading on the way back. Gray Star had plenty to say.
He wrote in shorthand. Tough to decipher. But, there's enough evidence to release my men. Nalan Fiskin's charges fell apart.
Need to go on the attack now. Before Fiskin's campaign recovers.
You mentioned a Nalan Fiskin is also making a bid to be opposition leader.
He's your rival, correct?
Yes. But he'll fail.
Attack, how?
He's thrown off balance. Striking now will put you ahead.
It's the perfect time.
Journals have some intel on Fiskin too. Hints he took a bribe from an Imperial prisoner. Revealing it would hit him hard.
You may not have all the facts. Speak to Fiskin before you reveal it.
Ask Fiskin about it, first.
Hmm. Don't want to be caught off guard again.
Attacking a man's reputation often has consequences for your own.
Just be careful.
I know what I'm doing.
The Balmorran people deserve to know what kind of man he is.
Then reveal it.
Done and done.
No idea why Gray Star didn't want me reading his journals. They're strange. So much history.
Talks about people I knew. Like they're still... Back to work.
Might have evidence to clear the charges against my men. Found Gray Star's journals.
Group of Balmorran resistance fighters were on a mission to Nar Shaddaa. Never left. They have copies of the journals.
Gray Star probably wanted to protect his ideas.
For safekeeping, I imagine.
In case what happened, happened. Plausible.
Balmorra's free, or close to it. Shouldn't they have come home by now?
Why are they still out there?
Considering what happened on Balmorra, you're fortunate any copies survived.
That's lucky.
Just have to collect them.
These men lost contact with us. Happens sometimes. They don't know Gray Star's gone, or anything else.
Their leader is Kaylan Jase. One of my trainees, once. I should go to Nar Shaddaa, tell him the news myself.
I'm sure he'll be glad to see you, despite the circumstances.
He'll appreciate that.
Plus, I can pick up the journals. Efficient.
Do you know what he was doing on Nar Shaddaa in the first place?
What was his mission there?
Sabotaging Imperial interests. Spice theft. Assassination. All the fun.
He'll want to know about Tai Cordan. And that Darth Lachris is dead.
And tell him Balmorra's free.
Still love hearing that.
Won't be gone long. Pick up a shuttle to Nar Shaddaa, meet Jase, bring the journals back. Simple.
Don't get shot while I'm away.
Secretary Varram came around. Gave his support. One step closer to being opposition leader. System works.
But there's another candidate back on Balmorra, Nalan Fiskin. He's trouble.
Knowing your foe is the first step.
Tell me about him.
He's a war veteran. Household name. Respectable.
What kind of support does he have?
How is he trouble?
People like him. War veteran, so military's on his side.
If you could stand up against the Empire, you can handle a political rival.
You can cope with one man.
Less complaining when Imperials are dealt with, though.
Fiskin's struck already. Arrested my followers back home, over an operation years ago. Says they set a bomb that killed Imperials, and Balmorran soldiers.
Those "Balmorrans" were traitors, selling ordnance to the Empire. Planned to destroy a village. My people saved lives.
Your followers should have stopped those traitors peacefully. They were Balmorrans too.
By taking other lives.
Collaborators die.
Was Fiskin aware of that when he arrested your followers?
Does Fiskin know?
No. Not common knowledge.
If people know your followers made that choice, that will destroy Fiskin's credibility.
Then tell the truth.
I need evidence.
Gray Star authorized the bombing. He kept detailed journals. The evidence I need.
All Gray Star's journals were destroyed on Balmorra--Darth Lachris's orders. Must be copies, elsewhere, though.
Proving your followers innocent is a worthy cause. If you need anything, just ask.
Let me help you.
Appreciated. Let me try first.
What happens if these journals are lost?
And if there's no copies?
I'll improvise.
Your rival already has the initiative. Don't give him more time to attack you.
Don't take too long searching.
I have plans.
No one's clean. Journals might have dirt on Nalan Fiskin, too. Fastest way to neutralize him.
If you do that, you're still just a terrorist, using the same tactics as before.
Will you never change?
My tactics work.
Let me know how the search goes.
Good luck finding them.
If Fiskin does have a shady past, surely it's your duty, as a Balmorran citizen, to reveal it.
An excellent plan.
I'll keep you apprised.
There's word from Balmorra.
People are calling me "politician", not "terrorist". Good start.
But I want the opposition leader's post. To critique Tai Cordan, keep him honest.
I hope you're not using this to get back at Tai, for not letting you in his government.
Is this revenge?
This is for Balmorra.
So how do you plan to become opposition leader?
Not an easy position to get.
Tai's an idealist. An opposition leader who knows the dirt and blood of politics will do him good.
He needs someone like you.
I thought so.
I want one of Tai's officials to support me. Secretary Varram would do. Tai trusts him.
But Varram's rich, stubborn. Hard to persuade.
Make your case to Secretary Varram that Tai will need strong opposition.
Just be honest with him.
Won't be enough.
If that's the case, perhaps you should try another official.
Do you really need him?
Varram is best. Talks loud, gets things done.
Tell me more about this Secretary Varram. There must be something we can use.
Everyone has a weakness.
Varram's paranoid. Terrified of another Imperial attack. He created a militia to guard Tai: funds it personally.
I could tell Varram that Imperials infiltrated his militia, but my people stopped them.
With a little "evidence", Varram owes me a favor. Easy.
Alternatively, a statement congratulating Varram on his militia's dedication would make him very grateful.
No. Praise his work instead.
Gratitude's fragile. But that would be faster.
Such a strategy would have to be handled very carefully.
It might work, but be careful.
Can but try.
Tell him you know about hidden stockpiles of weapons, for his militia. He'd believe that in a second.
Greed is a better lever.
I get his support, then the stockpiles are "stolen by Imperial spies". Yes.
You think like Gray Star sometimes.
You never told me what happened to him.
Where is Gray Star now?
You seem to think very highly of Gray Star.
Thank you.
Never having met Gray Star, I'm not sure what to say.
I hope that's a compliment.
He was a good man. Almost sharp enough.
Gray Star was betrayed. Blasted Empire got an operative into our cell. We scattered. But kept up the fight.
War's over. But we lost too much.
First victory as Balmorra's political liaison. Spoke to your diplomat Alauni; organized a new trade route for Balmorra.
She wanted a "personal favor", thought credits would look suspicious. Useful to know.
There's more to people than just what's tactically useful.
She's a person, too.
All secondary.
Just how personal is this favor you promised her?
A "personal favor", Zenith?
Personal enough.
Under that charm and beauty is a shrewd politician.
Don't underestimate her.
I'll remember.
Gray Star said a friend is an enemy waiting to happen, and vice versa.
You mentioned the name Gray Star once before.
Gray Star, again.
If that's the maxim you follow, no wonder you don't trust anyone.
How cynical.
Gray Star was smart.
This "Gray Star" may have had something there.
That makes sense.
He was leader of the resistance cell I first joined on Balmorra. Taught me plenty, before everything changed.
Enough. Got trade routes to organize.
I reorganized the munitions locker, between political briefings. More efficient now.
You have more orders?
Actually, I was hoping to talk to you.
No. I thought we could chat.
About what?
Was there someone you were fighting for--a wife, children?
Any family?
No. I fought for Balmorra.
I hope you enjoy traveling with us.
Do you like being aboard?
I'd leave otherwise. Problem solved.
Tai Cordan said that Zenith is a codename. What were you called before?
Is "Zenith" your real name?
"Zenith" will do. It's short.
Uh. So. Tai Cordan. Think he'll be a good president?
Tai's a decent man. He'll be good for Balmorra.
Yes, I do.
Good men and good presidents aren't the same.
That's up to Tai himself, and history's judgment.
I don't know.
Can't change the world sitting on a fence.
If Tai doesn't measure up, I'm sure other candidates could be found.
If not, he'll be replaced.
Wouldn't be easy, but possible.
Tai's inauguration was still a victory. Gray Star should have been there.
You don't have to be constantly on alert. Take some time to yourself.
You can relax, you know.
Can't relax if things are a mess.
I only need to know you'll be ready when the time comes.
Just be prepared.
Huh. Sounds like Gray Star talking.
Who is Gray Star?
Gray Star?
Old friend. Forget it.
Is something wrong?
You sound troubled.
It's all past. Forget it.
We'll talk another time, Zenith. I have matters to attend to.
I have to go.
Same here.
Need a word, back at the ship.
Need a word with you.
Actually, let's not talk.
Back to work. Be careful.
Let's go, Jedi.
You have more orders?
I'll keep you apprised.
I know what I'm doing.
Hello again.
Wasn't planning on dropping my guard yet.
Fascinating but pointless. Let's go.
Done and done.
Consider it done.
Think the rebellion's out of my system.
Jedi speak. Always useful.
I don't have weaknesses. Not against Imperials.
Should never be too trusting.
